title: Unlawful, irregular enrichment of Municipal Manager - Elias Motsoaledi Local Council.
text:
The Mpumalanga Party, as official opposition to the African National Congress within the ambit of the Elias Motsoaledi Local Council, exhausted all possible internal and external channels in its attempt to have ameliorated remedial action taken against the unlawful and irregular enrichment of the Municipal Manager (Me RM Maredi) employed by Council.
The Municipal Manager unilaterally increasing her salary in strict violation to the prescribed salary as gazetted for senior managers in category 3 (which Elias Motsoaledi Local Council indeed is) municipalities and as a consequence enriching herself unlawfully and irregularly.
Council then in its feeble attempt to cover up on its tracks and in trying to substantiate the increases clutching on straw all of which in no way justifies its actions taken and the overpayment remains and still is, unlawful and irregular enrichment.
Having followed all of the protocol within Council, without any success, and in view of the seriousness of the misdemeanor the Mpumalanga Party then filed criminal proceeding against the Municipal Manager with the Groblersdal SAPS but for some macabre reason the SAPS in the matter deciding that ‘there are no reasonable prospects of successful conviction’ and handed the case docket over to the Branch Commissioner Groblersdal for filing.
Fighting and eradicating this kind of obvious corruption, all at the personal benefit of one person, the Mpumalanga Party would therefore on Wednesday 21 st October 2015, file with the High Court of South Africa (Gauteng Local Division – Pretoria) a motion seeking relief in the matter and simultaneously seeking an order for the removal of the Municipal Manager forthwith from her position as such, as her actions and management style substantially contribute to the instability that is prevailing within Council at this point in time.
In its application to the High Court, the Mpumalanga Party is citing 16 respondents, all of which played a significant individual and or collective role to cover up this unacceptable modus operandi followed in the appointment, salary and remuneration determination of the Municipal Manager all of who failed good accountable, transparent governance, and in the process also manipulating the ‘wheels of justice’ to the advantage of the Municipal Manager.
In all likelihood the Mpumalanga Party would succeed in its draft order prayed for, and then all those players that contributed to this situation should be held accountable and ‘brought to book’ with the ‘full might of the law’, facing them.
All and everyone that is directly and indirectly part and parcel of this anomaly should therefore as a logical conclusion be removed from their positions, as they transgressed on their individual and collective conduct to use their powers inappropriately for the unlawful, irregular enrichment of an individual and that is considered as a serious transgression in the rules and conduct of councilors
